meanings.definition: The act of making something longer or stretching out.
meanings.sent1: The elongations of the rubber band were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting showed beautiful elongations of the figures.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved unexpected elongations of the scarf.
meanings.sent4: The elongations of time seemed to slow down during the thrilling ride.
meanings.sent5: The elongations of the bridge made it stand out among the other structures.

meanings.definition: The state of being elongated or extended.
meanings.sent1: The cat's playful elongations were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent2: The elongations of the shadows grew longer as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated elongations brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The elongations of the road seemed to lead to endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The elongations of the tree branches reached towards the sky.

meanings.definition: A lengthening or extension of something.
meanings.sent1: The elongations of the hair salon appointment caused a delay.
meanings.sent2: The elongations of the deadline made everyone work faster.
meanings.sent3: The elongations of the garden hose made watering the plants easier.
meanings.sent4: The elongations of the conversation led to a deeper understanding.
meanings.sent5: The elongations of the road trip added more excitement to the journey.
